ratings.comment: Cameron is the BEST PROFESSOR I have ever had. She is extremely kind, devoted to her students, and knowledgeable about the field that she is in. Everyone deserves to have a professor like this.

Professor Macdonald is an amazing professor. Not only does she work to get to know her students and their needs, but she's constantly engaging us. She's friendly, and easy to talk to. Not harsh, and very understanding about the workload that college students have. Always understanding about need for help, extensions. YOU DO NEED TO MAKE AN EFFORT.

I enjoyed this class and learned a great deal about the health care system(machine). Are you aware that drug companies are the third largest contributor to our nations GDP? how do you think that affects your health care? this was just one of the many interesting things we learned about.
The best professor I've ever had. She is clear and concise. Exams are straight forward and she makes the class interesting. Go Cameron!!!
My favorite professor on campus! Exams are always very fair and you get essay questions beforehand.  Lots of opportunities for extra credit.  Definitely made Soc theory bearable.

Awesome professor. Extraordinarily knowledgeable and very helpful. Yes you have to attend and should participate but this is a higher level sociology class, if you can't accomplish those basic requirements you shouldn't be taking anything 400+ level anyway. Must take this class if you have any interest in health care and health care policy.
great prof with a sense of humor. lectures are engaging and mandatory if you want to get your clicker points. exams are very fair and come straight from lecture, essays given beforehand

I think Professor MacDonald is a great teacher for Marriage and Family. She shares a lot of her own life experiences with her students and is always open for questions/comments. Tests are easy, she wants everyone to do well in her class.
AWESOME PROFESSOR. The class was engaging and easy if you actually showed up! Fun professor with great sense of humor and always willing to help.

Great teacher but very liberal and a flaming feminist. Definitely the most interesting class I took this semester. Clicker tests are annoying. Lectures usually incorporate videos and are interesting. Read the text pages and books she assigns and you'll be golden. Its hard to do badly on a test if you memorize the essay sheet. Overall good class.

I love this class.  It very interesting.  Good movies during lecture.  The tests are very fair...and easy...clicker questions make class mandatory--but they are easy...and there is extra credit!  one paper-7 pages, annoying to write, but not hard.

she's the worst professor to ever walk the earth. she needs to be medicated thoroughly, retrained to communicate with other humans, and have her teaching license taken away. i also got an A but wished i had died instead.
She was extremely rude and made students feel uncomfortable to speak up in class.  Definitely needed to be in control of everything including her students and TAs.  Seriously, not a cool woman.

The lectures do include movies/powerpoint/music so they aren't horrible, but the multiple choice test questions are very ambiguous.  She is kind of rude to the TA's and makes them run around the lecture hall with a microphone.  She asks for questions and is mean to kids who ask them.  Not my favorite class... and I thought I would love it.

The worst professor I've ever had, and I'm getting an A in the class! (Only because I'm a SOC major)  Seriously, the material is interesting but she DESTROYS it with her horribly organized lectures and constant need to overly-involve the audience.  Class is TOO structured!  She ALMOST made me want to drop my major, SO bad! Treats her TA's HORRIBLY!

She is the probably the worst teacher on campus. It is the longest 75 minutes of my life when I have to listen to her talk. She just doesn't know how to communicate to other people. The material is boring and common sense. The only reason you have to go to lecture is because 10% of your grade depends on you answering daily "clicker question".

She speeds through the lectures and forces nervous students to speak into microphones to ask or answer questions. She presents interesting subject matter in a BORING way. Exam essay questions are graded pretty harshly, but it's not too bad if you know the material. She words multiple choice questions ambiguous way, sometimes causing a lower grade.
awesome teacher, so knowledgable, brilliant, interesting, and it's just one of those classes were the lights are constantly going on. amazing

Easily the most terrible class I've taken here.  Aside from the obnoxiously unidimensional nature of the class (ie: adamant feminism, extremist liberalism), it's horribly disorganized and they try to take away the "blow-off" mentality of sociology classes by grading essays and papers with a chip on their shoulders.  DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!
No Comments

We are very lucky to have Cameron teaching. She taught at Ivy league schools, and you can tell. She is amazing at what she does, and really helps you learn a lot. Do all the extra credit that you can (which is really helpful, her class is based on 100 points..so one extra credit point is 1% on your grade--VERY NICE)
Tests aren't terribly difficult, but graded pretty harshly.  Material is interesting in spots.  Seems to be a huge feminist with a chip on her shoulder.  Discussions are usually fun.
She seems mean. The way she barks orders at the slideshow lady is just rude, but I don't even think she realizes that she's doing it. The material is interesting, but she isn't.

She really presents the material in a very interesting way (with guest speakers, video clips, etc.) SHE ALSO GIVES EXTRA CREDIT. The material is not hard at all. The essays she gives before the exam: KNOW THEM ALL BY HEART AND EVERY DETAIL. She grades the exams somewhat difficult but the mat. isn't.

She is very straight forward and to the point in lecture. For exams, she gives out a sheet a week or two before the exam with all the possible essay questions on it, and if those arent used in the essay section, she can use it in a different part of the exam. Offers E.C. Good fun professor!
Shes a great teacher and incorporates vidoes,tv and music into lectures. Interesting class and she offeres extra credit!!
